intro: Parnassia esquirolii, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with white markings and a hairy stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest understories. It has small, heart-shaped leaves and is often found at high elevations. Parnassia esquirolii is adapted to cold climates and is a member of the Ranunculaceae family.
